line.en: Ah, I got a mail.
It's way too early to be...
'...it's from Ageha?'
She's heading to the secret base right now.
Is she crazy?
It's just starting to get light outside!
Well it's at least bright enough to expect the\nathletics club to be out training right now...
...Reminds me of my cycle training.
I'd make breakfast for the crew and had to have\nit ready before anyone else even got up.
'Morning, Aoi... Hey, you're leaving already?'
'Yeah, I gotta head to the dock.'
I left the house in a dreary gaze, having said\npractically the same thing that the Kazato\nsisters had said moments before.
It's in the opposite direction of the school, so\nI've got to hurry.
'...Haaa... haaa... haaaa...'
Damn, I'm all tuckered out first thing in the\nmorning.
'...Haaa... haaa... haaaa...'
I got a jolt of energy and sprinted in Ageha's\ndirection.
'Helloooooo! Ageha, are you around?'
My voice echoed far and wide.
She's probably not here.
Wait, I someone was here.
I'm sure it of it. Someone was just here a moment\nago.
There was something resting atop a workdesk that\nseemed to be only half assembled.
It was the work of a pro... definitely not\nsomething Kotori the cripple could pull off.
'What's up with this guy? Does no one see what\ntime it is?'
There was a note.
'To Aoi... I updated the timetable for you. Maybe\nnext time you won't have to go 'undercover'\nwithout me.'
With Ageha's usual mark.
'An undercover mission...heh.'
Maybe I should be spending more time with\nHotaru... and spending less with Tobioka.
Yeah, that wouldn't be a bad idea at all. That\nguy's got some serious problems.
...Whoa, I feel kinda dizzy...
'I gotta take a seat... damn, I don't have time.'
*Looks down at his watch and sighs*
Man this place is far... there's no hope in\nmaking it in time.
I'm running as fast as I can... can I do it? Am I\ngoing to make it?
'...Haaa... haaa...haaaa...'
I, I can't believe it... I did it!
And I made it here in one piece, too.
And what do I get as my reward? Sweaty armpits!
'Huff...puff...uff...'
I headed to a water basin as soon as I calmed\ndown, but there wasn't anything I could really do\nabout all of the sweat.
'You made it! What's with all this sweat?'
'I didn't realize what time it was... not to\nmention how far I had to run...'
You'd think I just got out of morning drills with\nthe athletics club.
I got seated and caught my breath.
'Whew... hey, where's Ageha?'
'She was just here, but she just left and said\nshe won't be coming back.'
'Wait, the teacher's coming...'
...But Ageha didn't show up.
Even during attendance, she didn't.
Ageha's bag was resting next to her desk, though.
'Yo Minase, what's the deal with Himegi?'
'No idea... but why should I know?'
'Well, I guess you have a point.'
'It's obvious!'
'Apparently she's involved with someone else,\nthough.'
What's up with all of them?
'But I'm not sure how I actually feel about her.\nHm?'
I hear footsteps down the hall.
Someone's walking toward the classroom.
'Looks like she came after all.'
'Who's this?'
The pace of her footsteps was speeding up.
'Hey, sorry! I had stuff to take care of. I'm\nreeeaally sorry I didn't make it in time for HR!'
Ageha bolted toward her seat.
Well, she technically DID make it on time, even\nif she barely made it...
'Ooh, ooh...'
What's going on with the teacher?
He's acting all day dreamy and weird.
'Hmm?'
Even Ageha looked airheaded.
Some sort of strange atmosphere filled the room.
'I'm... I'm sorry for being late.'
'We get the picture already, now sit down!'
Why does everyone look like ghosts?
'That's so cool...'
'...What is?'
'Nothing~'
Kotori, with an annoying look on her face,\navoided making eye-contact with me.
'What's wrong, Aoi?'
'No, nothing really, I'm just feeling a bit\nweird.'
'Where were you, anyway?'
'I'll tell you about it later, okay?'
Class was about to begin, so we left the\nconversation at that for the time being.
...No one ever even brought up what it was that\nmade the air in the room change like that.
'Was it something I said?'
'Well, it seems like the newly-weds have kissed\nand made up.'
'What the heck?!'
'It must be nice finding the love of your life...\nnow drop dead and go to hell!'
Everyone in class looked absolutely mad. I need\nto get the hell out of there.
'Hey Kotori...'
'I've got training to do after this, so I should\nget going.'
Come on, Kotori! How are you going to just leave\nlike that?
'I need a break from this insanity, seriously...'
Ageha and I were both skeptical, but we just\nended up letting it go.
'I need to go and change into something more\nfitting...'
'Oh?'
Instead of flipping out on them and causing a\nscene, I headed to the lockers.
'Whoa!'
'Oh, Aoi...'
'Wh, what are you doing here?'
'I'm a teacher now, remember?.'
'Um, right... sorry, you just really surprised\nme.'
'I'm a teacher, you hear me!'
'Yeah yeah, Amane-sensei...'
As soon as those words left my mouth, a smirk ran\nacross her dumb face.
'But Amane..'
'Sensei!'
'Sensei, when did you say you'll start lecturing?\nAfter summer break?'
'You're onto something there!'
'Are you just planning everything out for now?'
'Not exactly. There's actually no need for that.'
'Why's that?'
'Well, um...'
'Do you mean that..?'
That would be impossible.
'You know, I was a student counselor once, and I\nbegan to think about what it would be like to be\na teacher.'
I knew it! She's not a teacher at all!
'Whatever the case, this is a big change for me.'
'Writing up exams, testing, endurance quizzes,\npreliminary exercises, all of that's mandatory to\nbe a teacher, right?'
'In order to be a teacher?'
'Yeah, but as you probably guessed, I'm probably\nthe worst teacher you'll ever know.'
Oh, I know.
'However, this isn't the sort of thing one can\nquit half-way through. I have to go the full\nmile.'
'I've gone through trial runs countless times,\nbut unless I force myself to try the real deal,\nI'll never understand what it's actually like.'
'Ah... you were wandering around the school one\nday and thought to yourself about how good it\nwould feel to be considered a teacher, right?'
'That's correct. You're a sharp kid.'
'I just knew I'd get it right if I could think of\nthe most pathetic excuse possible.'
'Whatever the case may be, I'm done with\ncounseling.'
'I'm sorry for saying what I've said about you.'
I could feel her eyes piercing my skull.
The students passing by us in the hall were all\nlooking our way.
Regardless, she's already well known around here.
Except for the newly registered students, every\none of us recognises her just by looking at her\nuniform.
We couldn't help to notice if she were to make\nthat switch from counselor to teacher.
'Oh, yes.'
Amane clenched her right fist and cupped it in\nher other hand, probably not aware that all the\nstudents around us were staring our way.
Then I got this really awful feeling in my\nstomach.
Suddenly her face was really, REALLY close to\nmine.
'Aoi, you and I have some things to discuss.'
'Y, yes?'
This woman needs to back off!
I can see her nose hairs from this distance.
Her polished lips were slowly moving in front of\nmy forehead.
'Let's get along.'
'...what?'
There had to be a huge question mark floating\nabove my head.
'I'm not sure what I should be doing, to be\nhonest, so it'd be great if you could teach me.'
Then she brushed her hand over my elbow.
'What are you doing?!'
'I'm guessing that this is what friends are\nlike?'
'Eh, uh, no, I...'
'Yeah, that's right...'
She just kept her hand on my elbow, and started\nmeditating.
I can understand doing this in a corner or\nsomething, but we're in the middle of the hallway\nand everyone's watching us!
'Ageha said, that she needed to avoid\nTobioka-sensei, right?'
Then, a sweet aroma reached my nose.
What's up with this smell? It's making me feel\nweird...
'So why don't you two get closer to each other?'

'Think about it, I'm a counselor, I'm in the
Soaring Club, and I'd be more than happy to hook
you up. Finding out how, though, is the real
problem.'
'Let's see... This is how Hotaru did it, right?'
Her hand descended from my elbow down to my hand.\nShe began to slowly rub my wrist...
She was wrapping her fingers around mine!
'Wha-, what!?'
Without being too forceful, I pulled my hand away\nand tried to run.
'What's your problem? If you really want to be\nfriends, why don't we hold hands?'
'No... I understand what you're trying to say,\nbut...'
I take it her idea of a 'friend' differs from how\nI define it.
This woman's got the wrong idea. I'm not your tea\nparty guest!
'Alright, let's do this.'
'W-wait, h-hold on!'
'Just think for a sec, if we're supposed to be\nfaking that we're members of the Soaring Club,\nthen it doesn't make sense to be friends, right?'
'Hmm?'
Ah, she's thinking.
'Oh!'
She clasped fist into her palm again with a loud\nsmack.
'Now that I think about it, what you say makes\nsense. I forgot that I'm a part of the group,\ntoo. You're quite the sharp one, Aoi.'
'Not really...'
Suddenly I felt a strong sense of fatigue.
'It's too bad, there's really no way we can be\nfriends.'
'That's fine. Alright so let's get this straight.\nWe're not friends. And we never will be friends\neither, get it? I hate you.'
...I wondered what was going on in her head.
'Oh! It seems that Amane and her boyfriend have\nreunited!'
'You're at it again, you cheating bastard! This\ntime it's with Senpai! Burn in hell, asshole!'
'Wait-- no!'
Why does everyone know about this?
'What's up with this lover's quarrel?'
'You, too?'
'Hahaha, I know.'
'If you're just going to disparage Amane, you\nshould bring up the fiasco she started with the\nwindmill!'
'What the heck's that supposed to MEAN?!?!'
I was so tired... to much confusion and\nscreaming... I laid my head on my desk.
After School.
'Everyone, over here!'
Ageha was blocking our way to the secret base.
All of the members of the Soaring Club were here:\nAgeha, Kotori, Asa, Yoru, and me.
'You planning on taking us anywhere?'
'The (Soaring Club's) outer club room.'
'The club room?'
'We got a secret base, don't we?'
'But that's outside of school grounds, so we've\ngot to try to keep it low.'
'Which means that we really should have a room\nthat's within school grounds, even if we end up\nnot using it.'
'Sure.'
'We'll go incognito!'
'Exactly!'

'However, that doesn't just mean we can set up a
base anywhere we'd like. Tobioka found out about
my old base from back at the Robot Club, and
confiscated the whole thing.'
'I've already been talking to others about\nborrowing a room for the Soaring Club.'
'Are you serious?!'
I was shocked at my own response.
'The Soaring Club?'
It's a club of bikers and car drivers; the\nso-called "Touring Club".
Since we call our group the Soaring Club, it\nmakes us sound like we create gliders and other\nflying equipment...
The Touring Group has the same thing going on,\nbut they're making engines instead of wings.
These types of groups are the only ones you'll\nfind claiming that they're a part of the\nengineering field.
'Many of the things these types of clubs do are\nsimilar to each other, and if you think about how\nmany people have joined ours.'
'We got the Touring Group to agree that we could\nshare the room, and even got approval from the\nStudent Council.'
'So we politely borrow one of the PCs for the\nSoaring Club and throw up some info on gliders\nthat no one will care about...'
'Like books on aviation and the engineering of\nflight, all sorts of periodicals... we leave it\nthere and know one will suspect anything.'
'Since we're sharing the room with the Touring\nClub, we've basically got everything figured\nout!'
Awesome!
'We've just got to make sure that once class is\nover, we all need to come to this "new club room"\nbefore we head to the secret base.'

'I've already placed shoes near the doors for
when we exit the building, and we'll probably be
able to leave from the other side without
problems either.'
'You must've been busy doing all of this stuff\nfor us.'
'Well, it's not gonna get done by itself!'
Heh, her nose just got a little longer. Look at\nthat prideful face of hers.
'We can do this! But Ageha wasn't the only one\nworking hard on this, you know...'
Kotori's face was beaming with admiration.
Ageha's lip was twitching for some reason.
'Nah, I'm not sure how you all will make\nyourselves useful from now on...'
'What?'
Ageha's attitude suddenly went sour.
'To be honest... I'm not really sure if I'm on\nboard with this whole thing.'
'We got the approval from the Student Council and\neverything, but let's be honest... the Touring\nClub's got more... prerequisites.'
'What do you mean by 'prerequisites'?'
'For that, I'll need everyone's cooperation.'
'Us all? What do you want us to do?'
'Ah, well... I haven't exactly...'
'Spit it out, we ain't got all day!'
'...Alright Kotori, smile.'
'Try to smile.'
'I'm not even happy. How can you expect me to\nsmile?'
'How about you two, Asa, Yoru?'
'Cheese!'
'I agree with Habane. I can't smile if I don't\nknow why I'm smiling.'
'Come on, you've all had to greet guests into a\nstore before and smile for your jobs. This is the\nsame thing!'
'I've never had a job before.'
'Me too, there's never been a reason for me to\nsmile.'
'Ah-, you guys suck...'
'Alright, alright. Well there's a first time for\neverything, now, let's see some smiles!'
Ageha whipped out her cell phone.
'Okay! Kotori one smile for the camera! Aren't\nyou a cute one, so sexy and sophisticated...'
Kotori sent a glare her way.
'Please! I need everyone's cooperation here!'
'What's this all about?'
'Um, it's kinda hard to explain, but...\nessentially...'
'Ah, that's what she's after...'
Everyone suddenly looked my way.
'Well the Touring Club's got real cars and\nmotorcycles, and an actual research group.'

'They've got components for engines, manufacture
machine parts, and they've got pros working in
their group. They're one of the groups that make
this school look good.'
'Their hiring rate of that group is 120 percent\nmeaning that they've already got jobs lined up\neven before they're juniors.'
'But it's not like we've got anyone with that\nsort of skill...'
'So we've got to flaunt our manliness instead!'
Yeah, this school is filled with girls, but many\nof these clubs are unpopular among females.
Oil, gas, tools, metallurgy, mass, and torque...\nthat's what makes mechanical maintenance what it\nis.
'We could always work on the teachers' cars at no\ncost and claim that it's covered as a part of our\nclubs activities...'
'While we're at it, why don't we offer advice to\nteachers looking to buy new cars? '
'All of the repair shop owners around town know\neach other. They'd be invincible if we got them\ninvolved at the school!'
'However, there's still one major problem.'
I clenched my fist.
'There's not enough female members!'
'Right! That's right!'
We smell like oil, our fingers are black, we've\ngot stains up to our knees and elbows, and we've\ngot burn spots and holes in our uniforms.
But it's these stains and burn holes that makes\nus who we are, the ones who can fix any sort of\nmachine with our wrenches and crowbars.
Sure, we look like a bunch of hoodlums...
And that's probably keeping girls from joining...
But we can't just let such a thing keep us from\nfighting for more female recruits... whoa, I'm\ncrying.
'Well! Now that that's over... All I'm asking is\nthat you try your best.'
'Ageha?!'
Kotori sent that same glare past her once more.
'What part of what he said are you agreeing with\nexactly?'
'I mean, you know, it's not like we're asking\neveryone to sacrifice their lives for this club!'
'Oh, you aren't? Enlighten us.'
'All I'm saying is that we have prerequisites for\nborrowing the room...'
'What 'prerequisites' are you talking about?'
She better be careful what she says, or\neveryone's out.
'I'm just asking that we spend a little bit of\ntime each day to show up here...'
'...We should all know each other's names...'
'If that's all you're requiring, then...'
'Yeah, I can remember a few names.'
'Great!'
'Even if I'm the only one who follows the\nrules... that's fine.'
'Of course, we have to abide by the rule that no\ngirl should be left alone in a room and there's\nabsolutely NO TOUCHING allowed!'
'That's obvious!'
'The others couldn't handle that last one, so I'm\njust passing this by you.'
'Well then, I didn't expect that.'
'Oh really...'
And I can understand why...
I was in an all-boys school before this one.
It's just that a club full of guys wants a little\nbit of female attention, if he can get it.
'Alright, club leader! I'm counting on you!'
'Now that we've finished our negotiations, I'm\nexpecting a lot from you.'
'What, do you mean?'
'You know, like, greeting people!'
'Greeting... how?'
'Come on~~'
Now it was Ageha giving Kotori the condescending\nstare.
And then, as you would expect...
'Greeting them, with a club handshake!'
'...What?'
Everyone looked at the new club leader, Kotori.
Kotori's one of those types with an incredible\nbeauty.
The head of the Touring Club is older than I am,\nbut I know her figure better than he does.
'The word 'untidy' would probably be the best way\nto describe a body like that.
Kotori, naturally, would know that.
Her skin is white and pure, as though there was\nno blood in her body.
'You're not a bad person at all! You're really\npassionate, and you're always cheering us on!'
'Well then why don't you try do it for a change!'
'There's nothing I can do if you just call it as\ncommon courtesy. If it means that much to you,\nI'll do it too!'
'Alright then, you can be club leader! I'm fine\nas the president!'
'Is that really wanted to be coming into this?!'
'Hold on, hold on, aren't all of you forgetting\nsomeone here?'
It was obvious that I was right for the job.
'Let's make it clear to you all. As of today, I\nam your new club leader!'
'Ehh, aren't YOU forgetting something?'
'Forgetting what?'
'Who's the one whom everyone rated as the #1\nmember of the Soaring Club?'
'Who is the one whom no one in this club knows,\nwho doesn't even go to this school?'
'But she's a president, not a club leader...'
'Then would you be alright if the stakes were\nreversed?'
'Little by little, Kotori's name has been\nbecoming more popular. That's the only reason why\nthe others have given us the OK!'
'It's no use to argue... right?'
'Yeah, there's no use in arguing.'
'Without further ado, get on with it, Kotori!'
'You don't have to be so damn happy about it!'
'We're depending on you Kotori, don't let us down\nnow. We're trying to pass through the clouds,\ndon't forget that!'
I gripped the back handles of the wheelchair.
'Nooooooo!'
'Smile, smileô'
'Kotori's gotta smile, too!'
'Learning the art of the business smile will\nprove useful throughout one's life!'
'You TRAITOOOOOR!'
All of us combined our spirit and headed to "The\nRoom" together.
At that point, we all came to a decision.
'The secret handshake shared among club leaders\nwas actually pretty slick.
That was because Kotori's partner was more\nnervous than she was, and because he didn't have\nany confidence before he even touched her hand.
It didn't help that Kotori made jeering comments\nat her partner's body smell and torn clothing.
'I understand that you use smelly things and it's\neasy to get dirty, but that doesn't mean that you\nhave to leave yourself in such a mess!'
'How about you wash yourself up every once in a\nwhile!'
'The reason why no one likes us is because we're\njust a bunch of smelly rogues! '
The Touring Club would always be called the\nWheelchair Beauties and such. I don't know how\nthey could put up with that.
After that, Kotori, with the wrath of a merciless\ndictator, entered the Touring Group and changed\ntheir image.
Good thing that everything progressed the way it\nshould, we'd say.
And even today, Ageha didn't come to the secret\nbase.
We're trying our best to keep everything going\nwithout her.
'Shouldn't we be getting back soon?'
'Ah, I didn't realize what time it is...'
We have a lot to take care of when we get back to\nthe dorms, too. We should get back and start\nmaking supper.
'It doesn't seem like Ageha's coming today,\nanyway.'
'Yeah, it's too bad. Shall we get going then?'
'You act like you know what's going on here.'
'This morning it was the same thing. If you've\ngot something to say just come out and say it,\nalright?'
'She's not coming, is she?'
'Well it damn well doesn't seem like it. I wonder\nwhat's up with that.'
'You said it yourself, she's not coming. Let's\nget out of here, everyone!'
'Okay!'
'I'm ready to go!'
'Ehhh...'
'Great job today, everyone...'
'Ah... again?'
'Sorry guys, I'm here because Ageha's not coming.\nYou and I are partners today, Aoi.'
'Yeah, thanks...'
'Next time, I'll eat sweets and read manga on my\nway over.'
'Ageha... better be careful while your sister's\nwatching!'
'Thanks for coming to meet us, Hotaru.'
'Good evening...'
'You shouldn't worry about your older sister too\nmuch. She's almost always right about anything.'
'Then maybe you should listen to her advice\nsometime, club leader.'
'Did you lock the door? Alright then, let's get\nout of here!'
'Let's go!'
'There's not really any way we can move on. We\nneed Ageha.'
'You're right.'
We need to still work on the hull and handle\nforeign negotiations, and Ageha's really the only\none who can do that.
'But it would be nice to just, you know, hear a\nlittle more from her on what she's doing.'
'Right! She needs to keep us in the loop if she\nexpects us to help out.'
'Precisely.'
Kotori looked at her right hand with an odd\nexpression on her face.
'Tomorrow's flight training. You're going,\nright?'
'Ah, it's supposed to be the last flight before\nsummer break, right?'
'I just want to hurry up and fly in our new-model\nplane instead of that old piece of junk we use\nfor training...'
'Me too...'
That's why we need Ageha!
What the heck's she doing?
'Why don't we just go instead of hanging around\nhere?'
We won't have to work like slaves at the dorm\nsince it's a holiday.
'I'm heading out!'
I took my phone out of my pocket and took a look\nat it.
I sent Ageha a message, but never got a response.
Well it's already late, so she's probably\nsleeping.
Even so, it'd be nice to get a reply before she\nwent to bed.
I headed over to the train station, and went\nstraight to the runway.
This is the training that I put all of my\nprecious time and money into. I can't put even a\nsecond to waste.
Even if it seems pointless, I at least have to\ntest how I perform, remember my mistakes, and\nlearn to focus on what matters.
Fly, fly, fly, my goal is to get in the air as\nmuch as I can.
I'm nowhere near the level I want to be. I need\nto study more.
About the air, about airflow, about piloting, I\nneed to learn it, experience it, I need it in me\nlike I need air in my lungs.
The instructor's kind enough to praise my\nefforts, but just efforts won't get you anywhere.
Last year's run in with that violent\nundercurrent... I'll need to deal with winds like\nthat as though its second nature.
I spent several hours at the runway and returned\nback to the dorm.
'Wheeeeew.'

I didn't feel even an ounce of fatigue while I
was flying, but as soon as I got on the train
back home, my entire body felt like it was being
tortured and mutilated.
'Damn, this pain...'
Can I go on like this?

I checked out how things were going at the secret
base during a light run, and thought I'd continue
on some work I started if I didn't feel too
tired.
I'll rest after I'm done here. I'll be alright.
'Oh, it's Aoi!'
'Kanako?'
'Hi! Are you coming back from your flight\ntraining?'
'Uh, yeah...'
'Great job this week, as with every other.'
'The same to you, and I apologize for not having\nthe time to clean the dorm today.'
'No, no. You're fine. We can't just have you\ndoing all of the work around here while we take\nit easy, you know!'
'I appreciate your concern.'
'Well we should be get going now.'
Kanako grabbed my arm.
'...what?'
'Yes, 'we' should get going!'
'To where?'
Perhaps Kanako wants to see our secret base as\nmuch as Hotaru does?
'Of course, here!'
'...Umm, you see...'
'It's fine and all that your building gliders,\nbut you need a break every now and then.'
'How about you let me treat you to some coffee or\nsomething sweet.'
'Whaaat?'
Just 'cause she's buying me some coffee doesn't\nmean she's impressed of me or anything.
I've gone and created an awkward situation for\nmyself. Next thing I know I'm sitting in a food\ncourt with her at the same table.
We get ice cream for two.
'Cafe Flags was packed today, eh?'
'It's not a cheap cafe, I understand...'
'No, you got it wrong, ...tee hee.'
She suddenly stared into my sullen eyes.
'Wh-what is it? '
'It'd be hard for you to say yes to me going over\nthere, right?'
'I'm not sure what you mean...'
'I know you're interested in taking another girl\nwith you... you must have someone in mind, am I\nright?'
'Not really. I'm not even thinking about what you\nsaid right now.'

'So you're saying I'm missing the mark. Ah, so
I'm guessing you also think what I'm wearing
right now is my normal clothing, and not just my
underwear!'
'Nothing of the sort! Don't talk about that sort\nof thing in a place like this!'
'Underneath those clothes, that soft, that HOT\nbody...it gets you excited.'
'It doesn't!'
'It doesn't?'
'No, it doesn't!'
Okay, so maybe a little, but she'll never know.
It's just really hard because my heart races when\nshe talks like that.
That's why I'm on edge.
'What do you consider me as?'
'I think of you as a boy.'
'And aren't all boys thinking the same thing?'
'Well, generally speaking, boys, including\nmyself, get a little excited when we see a girl\nwe like!'
'How excited?'
I ignored that one.
'If you're just going to tease me, I'll just make\nmy way back home now. I've got a lot of errands\nto run.'
'Oh, I'm sorry about that! I didn't want upset\nyou! I just wanted to give you a little bit of\n'assistance'.'
Kanako placed her elbows on the desk.
Just as she was leaning forward, I could see her\nchest swelling up in front of me. I couldn't help\nbut watch her cleavage jiggle back and forth.
And what's this about 'assistance'?
No, I didn't see anything! I'm not looking!
'Hmm?'
Kanako laughed as the wind blew past us.
There's no way I can get out of a conversation\nwith her while we're both here.
'So I heard...'
'What's it this time?'
'Mochizuki, or perhaps I should call her Miss\nAmane, not sure. Anyway, have you two hooked up\nyet?'
'You've got the wrong idea!'
'We're not lovers or anything. To say that we'd\never do anything like that... it's\ninconceivable!'
'Well then you need to apologize to her.'
'Where does she even come up in all of this?'
'She's far different than you and I may think.\nThere's a lot we don't know about her, according\nto her friends.'
'Like who?!'
'The tickets to the first-annual Aoi Minase\ncompetition are now on ô'
'As of now there's some competition, but soon\nwe'll have many losers...'
'We've gotta take a look at how strict the dorm\nrules are.'
'None of us are actually making any money off of\nthis, so we'll be alright.'
'That's obvious!'
'You'll just be getting a pair of panties out of\nthe deal...'
'That's worse!'
'Alright, who's the sure thing? We've got to\nchoose now or you'll never hear the end of it.'
'Hmmm...'
I tried to pick who'd be the sure thing...
...But for some strange reason, I wasn't able to\nform the words with my mouth.
Kanako began to break into a smile.
'I am really, really grateful for what you've\ndone for us, Aoi.'
'I'm just doing what I'm paid for...'
'No, no, not just what you've done for the\ndorm...'
'It's such a relief that you're a boy.'
'...what?'
'If the new dorm tenants end up being girls...'
'Well even so, you make mistakes when you're\nyoung, and end up being the mistake half of the\ntime.'
'I kinda understand what you mean, because I went\nto a all-boys school before.'
Without a woman to keep them tame, men are just\ndogs. Filthy, disgusting, and rebellious.
Even I can't claim to be any different.
Girls are the same. Being stuck in a single-sex\nschool is the worst.
If I were a flying fish, I'd...
'Right, you'd be carefree. Only girls ...'
'I know.'
'But of course, without that, you won't yet even\nknow what it means to be human.'
'That's why, Aoi, with you around, I feel human.'
'But I'm no one important! I'm just being\nmyself...'
'Even this chance to meet gave me the opportunity\nto tell you what's on my mind. I'm talking about\nwhat it means to be right here, right now.'
'I understand.'
'Why don't you try to live in a place where it's\nall-women?'
'That'd probably be... a bad idea...'
At first I was feeling tension in my chest, but I\nsuddenly got used to it.
It's actually gotten a lot easier to find used\npanties left in the laundry machine that girls\nend up throwing away.
When you're with a bunch of guys all day, you\nbegin to forget what it feels like to hold the\nopposite sex in your arms.
Yeah, I definitely can't say that!
'You've got a nasty, nasty mind.'
'But it's fine, I know plenty enough about boys\nto guess what's going on up there...'
'...And down there, too. Like when you're\nsleeping, right? It does that thing...'
'What are you talking about?'
'I'm just talking about your sleeping habits!\nWhat did you think I was talking about?'
She knows what she's doing.
I gotta stop while I'm ahead, or I'll play right\ninto her trap.
'Hey, you didn't answer my question!'
'And you know, afterward, when it gets dark...\nwhat do you think about having that conversation\nalone, just the two of us?'
'I think I'll pass.'
I actually said it while keeping my composure\nthis time.
'Is it really so bad to have a 'sure thing'?'
'That's...'
I was speechless.
The moment she said the word 'sure thing' I\ncouldn't help but think of someone in particular.
Once that image popped into my head, I was so\nashamed of myself that I felt like dying. I\nwanted that image out of my mind.
Throughout it all, I couldn't process what was\ngoing on at all.
The whole time Kanako was eating, she watched me\nwith a cheesy grin smeared across her face.
'I must me soooo fortunate to witness such a rare\nsightô'
Why the heck do you get off on someone else's\nstruggles?!
'S...sorry, I just got a message...'
It's from Ageha.
'From Ageha, I guess?'
'How do you know that?!'
'Just a feeling...'
'You called Kama, then?'
'No, it's not really big enough of a deal for\nthat...'
'Is it really okay for you to not check on your\nmail?'
'Excuse me, please...'

I'm over at the secret base. Everything's going
according to plan. Will you be back here soon?
How was your day? I'll be waiting for you if
you're around.
It was such a carefree letter. I felt strangely\nrelieved.
'Sorry. Ageha and everyone is waiting for me over\nthere. '
'Oh dear! That's too bad. You'll have to just go\nahead and apologize for me.'
'And what are you apologizing for?'
'You've been with me for so long today that it's\nprobably overlapping with some other errands\nyou've got to run.'
'Not really, it's fine.'
'Is that so? Well then why don't we see what you\nlook like without any clothes on!'
'That's... not in any weird sense, right?'
'No, not at all... Not even a little bit.'
'Not even a little bit, huh?'
'Nope. Just trust me...'
'But if you'd like, I can calm you down first...'
'Thanks for all the trouble. I've got to get\ngoing.'
'Ah, just when I was having fun...'
'You're not leaving just to get away from me,\nright?'
'Aoi, you'd be better off understanding the\nfeelings that are bubbling up in your head right\nnow. It'll lead to a better life.'
'Huh, huh, huh...'
I'm a bit confused as to what just happened, but\nI can't let that distract me.
Just gotta run straight there. We've already got\nfood at the event.
The sky's still bright; it's not like I'm holding\nanyone up.
If I hurry things up, I can help out when I get\nto the runway.
'Huh, huh, huh...'
'Ugh, ugh, ugh...'
'You made it!'
'Ageha?!'
I was too out of breath to ask her why she was\nhere.
'Wow, I was expecting you to be here right about\nnow.'
'Great... Well I'm here... So...'
'You didn't have to rush over here so quickly...\nLook at you!'
'No, I wanted to get here... as fast as I could.'
'Well whatever then, good job getting over here.\nHow was your day?'
'Things went alright. I was able to get in a few\nmore hours of independent training than usual.'
'That's great to hear. We're depending on your\nskill to get us up in the air, you know.'
'Thanks. You can depend on me for this one. How\n'bout you?'
'I'm ready when you areô'
'Oh, nice job. But you've been doing this for a\nwhile now, haven't you?'
'Well yeah, but since there are tests, the work\nis really cut-throat, and I've got to ace it all\nby the second half of summer break.'
'That sucks...'
'Yeah, it does. I've gotta think of something\nthat'll make it suck less.'
Here we are talking about how working conditions\nsuck, but we're talking about it so calmly.
'Are you doing okay? Let's go inside!'
She is to kind, she even gives me a chance to\ncatch my breath before we head inside.
'Welcome back!!'
Everyone was lined up, waiting for the two of us.
But there was something a little bit 'off'.
'He's real!'
'Right?'
They were staring right at me and whispering just\nout of earshot.
'So awesome.'
'What, exactly?'
'Forget about it...'
'What is it?!'
'Here's a towel.'
She threw a wet towel my way.
'Oh, thanks for that.'
'Do you need something to drink?'
'No, I'm good.'
...'Cause I was out drinking water with Kanako\njust a moment ago.
'Something's been getting at me, Ageha. What's up\nwith everyone acting so weird all of a sudden?'
'Oh, is that so?'
'Did something happen before I got here?'
'Nothing out of the ordinary. We were just\nworking hard together.'
'Yeah...'
I wonder what it could have been.
The dock was filled to the brim with resources\nthat weren't there before.
There were pipes and tools laying around what\nappeared to be a construction site.
'An-chan sent it over. He's lending it to us.'
'Ah, okay then.'
We placed a scaffolding around the site, and\nbuilt wings for the plane.

Wings, you see, aren't exactly flat, and they're
not single-layered either. It's an incredibly
complex process to make a wing, and we needed to
calculate every step perfectly to build the right
ones.
Amane actually wrote up a schematic for us.
We'll be using that to build the wing, but\nwhether or not we'll be successful is another\nissue.
The real test of my worth to this group was about\nto begin.
'Alriiiiight!'
After letting in a little bit of energy, I\nthrusted one hand into the other.
I got this! Let's go! With everyone's energy\nwe'll build this plane and fly it in no time!
'I'm sorry, Aoi, but I won't be around for a\nwhile after today.'
'What's it this time?'
'You need a lot of things to work on your\nprojects, right? So I made preparations so that\nTobioka won't figure out what's going on.'
'Let us take care of it for you...'
'No, it's fine. I've got connections. You all\nshould be off doing your own thing.'
'But even if that's the case, we can't get\nanything done without you. We need you.'
'Don't be so dramatic.'
'You'll be fine. Aoi, I believe in you.'
'But listen, we've only got one shot at this.\nWe've got no room for failure. That's why I'm\nasking you.'
'I know, I feel the same way.'
'But even if I don't come helping out, you'd\nstill be prepared to try, right?'
'Well yeah, but...'
'Of course I'll help you out as much asI can...'
'I'm sorry I have to ask you to do this, but\nplease... if we're really going to make this\nthing, we need you or we won't succeed.'
'Seems like you've gotten a bit better at riding\nyour friends instead of doing the work yourself.'
I headed back to the dorm. I wondered whether or\nnot what she said made any sense. I manipulate\ngliders, not people.
She hasn't sent me a mail.
Today didn't seem like a day Ageha would be out\nearly to train at the dock.
Plus, I made breakfast for everyone just in time\nbefore you all wake up.
'Good morning!'
I get a weird feeling that I'm screwing\neverything up when I see her.
'This is about yesterday?'
I had to tell someone.
'Yeah, it is. I feel safe in the room '
'Everything's fine, but you keep your head up.'
'You're going to need a good rationalisation for\nyour new project.'
'Rationalisation?'
I learned what this word meant after I registered\nfor high school.
'Wow!'
'I apologize for the inconvenience, but could you\nplease give me a little more time to prepare the\nroom?'
'That is fine.'
Akari sat up straight and faced me head-on.
'Minase, a little bird has talked to me a bit\nabout your recent love affairs.'
'...what?'
'We've even got a little evidence on your hands.'
'What exactly do you have?'
'Kanako and you were apparently dating at one\npoint.'
'No, you've got it mixed up! That's not how it\nwas at all!'
'Such good friends and all, so you just happened\nto share an ice cream... is that correct?'
'That's an indirect kiss, you know! I envy you,\nboy!! Akari and I haven't even gotten to second\nbase yet!!!'
'Oh just shut up, Masatsugu.'
'You're as sharp as ever, honey!'
Let's just drop the subject...
'Who's the one spreading rumors like those?'
'A fountain of infinite resources informs us of\neverything. It even provides photos. Wanna see?'
'No, thanks...'
It makes sense, practically everyone around us\nwas watching...
'But I was only there because Kanako asked me to\njoin her...'
'You should be proud of your accomplishments\ninstead of being ashamed of them.'
'Seriously, you should just be quiet!'
'Yeah!'
They seemed happy just to have a chance to scold\nme.
Have I really submitted myself to this much\ntorture?
'And how about Mochizuki-senpai? How shall I\ndescribe that situation?'
'What?'
'You were hugging in the hallway, were you not?\nWould you not consider that to be an infraction\nof the school code of conduct?'
'I really just think you're just misunderstanding\nthis...'
There's nothing I can say to having been seen\n"hugging".
How annoying, having to explain to these people\nwhat I did so I don't attract Tobioka's attention\nto our group.
'Oh really?'
'Can we just let this go?'
'We get what you're trying to say.'
They don't believe me?!
'Well, both Kanako-san and Mochizuki-senpai are\nthose types of people... So it's realistic that\nyou just got caught in their mess.'
'With you, everything's always going to work out\nin the end, even if no one is there to understand\nyou.'
'What, you mean that there's no chance in me ever\nbeing fully understood?'
'Are you not aware of this already?'
'Well...'
'Give me a break. I've got plenty of girls!'
'But still, it's so good that you are here for\nme, Akari!'
'Except, I'm not.'
'Don't say such things!'
'Just pay attention to how you behave, alright?\nYou never know if others are watching!'
'I can't tell you exactly, but there's someone\nout there who's watching your every move, and\nthey're willing to make it into a scandal.'
'Understood...'
I think I've said what I think I've needed to\nsay. My face feels soft from the weak muscles in\nmy face.
'Do you really want to beat around the bush with\nthis?'
'If only you could give us some explanation that\nstates otherwise...'
'You 'need' an explanation...'
'Alright, listen. You and I are really similar;\nno matter how much we talk to women, we aren't\neven understood, let alone remembered!'
'Is that really something to be proud of?!'
'I'm just picking something out of the blue,\nhere. Ageha doesn't even have all of her stuff\ntogether!'
I suddenly turned pure white.
'Hold on a sec, what's that name doing over\nthere?'
'You idiot! No one else is here!'
'Hold on, I'm trying to get situated...'
'It doesn't matter how you look at it or where\nyou see it from. Ain't that right, Akari?'
'Sure we're friends and everything, but just\nfriends, you got it? Nothing more...'
'Yeah, sure.'
His response was so condescending...
'What do you want?!'
'Nothing~'
'Are you being honest? I hear you've got really\nhigh-grade body sensor.'
'A sensor?'
'Yeah, it confirms your current location, and you\ncan share it among friends.'
'Which is helpful because it helps you pay\nattention to who is nearby you.'
'Miss Himegi just happened to be around, but she\nsoon came this way when she has seen that you\nwere nearby.'
I guess it could work in theory...
'So that's how it is...'
There's that strange face again. The atmosphere's\nnot the same as it was a few days ago.
'But before all of this technology, we learned of\neach person's patterns and would meet based on\nthe schedule they had produced for themselves.'
'Definitely.'
'But it's still a long way's off.'
'Seriously! If that's the case, I already know\nplenty about you Aoi.'
'But you never cheered us on or supported us...'
'That's a completely separate topic, anyway.'
'But it's not as though this whole thing just\nstarted, either.'
'Ageha and I may or may not have a thing for each\nother. We see each other occasionally.'
'It's great and all if you feel like you've found\nyour match.'
'We're not here to prevent guys and girls from\nhooking up or anything...'
'Awesome!!'
'However, if you cross the line, you might get an\nappropriate punishment.'
'That's mean!'
We started ignoring Masatsugu's calls for\nattention.
'Well then...'
Akari and Masatsugu left as I got prepared.
'Yo, playboy. Next time you should hook up with\nthe president.'
Dumbfounded, I looked around to see where\nMasatsugu had gone.
Akari and the others, too; we should reward them\nfor their hard work!
